entry.title: Charles De Geer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that entomologist Charles De Geer made all the illustrations for his eight-volume work himself (example pictured)?

entry.title: Sheikh Mujibur Rahman's 1974 speech at the United Nations (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the anniversary of Sheikh Mujibur Rahman's 1974 speech at the United Nations has been observed as Bangladeshi Immigration Day in New York since 2019?

entry.title: Bazaruto Island (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that thousands of crocodiles were once farmed on Bazaruto Island?

entry.title: flag of North Korea (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the flag of North Korea has been mistakenly used by international organisations to represent South Korea?

entry.title: Marie Breen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Marie Breen retired from the Australian Senate to care for her husband, who had been badly injured in a car accident?

entry.title: 2024 MLS All-Star Game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lionel Messi and Luis Suárez were picked for the 2024 MLS All-Star Game but could not play?

entry.title: Josep-Lluís Serrano Pentinat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Spanish bishop Josep-Lluís Serrano Pentinat is expected to be a future head of state of Andorra?

entry.title: Upper Skagit Indian Tribe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after becoming a religious leader of the Upper Skagit Indian Tribe, Slaybebtikud united the tribes and established himself as their sole leader?

entry.title: Oedipus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Wolfgang Rihm said of the music of his 1987 opera Oedipus: "Sound is a weapon here – or a scalpel"?
